data.text:
Shaq's height is 7'1" (216cm).

Certainly, your jaw might have dropped after seeing what giant of a man Shaq is, right? Well, his physique and hard work have led him to become one of the greatest basketball players of all time. So, donât you want to dive deeper into Shaqâs life and learn more about it?

Shaquille Rashaun OâNeal was born on the 6th of March, 1972, in Newark, New Jersey, U.S. He was named by his mother Lucille OâNeal, and grew up with his stepfather, Phillip Harrison. In 2016, following Harrisonâs death, Shaq met his real father, Joseph Toney.

Nevertheless, OâNeal had become 6â10â tall by the age of 16. And during his time at Robert G. Cole High School, he led his team to a 68-1 record. Whereas, despite pursuing his NBA career, the star continued his education at Louisiana State University.

Shaq Bio

In the 1992 NBA draft, the Orlando Magic drafted O'Neal with the 1st overall pick, and the star was named Player of the Week right after that. After a year, Shaq also received the Rookie of the Year and was voted an All-Star starter just like the legend, Michael Jordan.

Nonetheless, the star was absent during the 1995-96 season after taking a major injury. After countless downfalls, the star joined the Los Angeles Lakers on a seven-year, $121 million contract. But, the starâs injury again caused him to miss over 30 games.

However, Shaq never gave up, becoming one of the rare basketball players to be elected to both the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame and the FIBA Hall of Fame.

Physical Measurement & More

Well, itâs very common for people to be interested in Shaqâs physical measurements, as he has a large size. Hence, we will make it easier for you to learn more about Shaq with the following statistics.

Facts

Shaquille Rashaun OâNealâs first job before the NBA was at Burger King. And ironically, the star now owns his own franchise, Big Chicken, which specifically focuses on fast foods such as burgers.

Shaq has scored over 28,596 points in his basketball career, which makes puts him at rank 7 in the respective category.

The star was blessed with height genetics, as by the age of 10, he was already 6â4â tall.

Shaq has been diagnosed with Osgood-Schlatterâs disease, a condition that causes pain and swelling below the knee joint, which caused many problems for the star during his basketball career.

Shaq retired from basketball in 2011, after which the star tried pursuing a rap career, which unfortunately didnât work out as he had thought.
